questionTitle: Which of the following algorithm is used by Google to determine the importance of a particular page?
questionExplanation: Content on pages is scanned up to a certain number of words and placed into an index.

questionOption1: With PaaS, the goal is to create hosted scalable applications that are used in a Software as a Service model
questionOption2: Applications built using PaaS tools need to be standards-based
questionOption3: In Wolf, the data and transaction management conforms to the business rules you create
questionExplanation: Wolf lets you work with Adobe Flash or Flex or with Microsoft Silverlight.

questionTitle: Which of the following figure correctly describe major features provided by Google App Engine?
questionExplanation: For an application to run on GAE, it must comply with Google’s platform standards, which narrows the range of applications that can be run and severely limits those applications’ portability.

questionTitle: Based on PageRank algorithm, Google returns __________ for a query that is parsed for its keywords.
questionExplanation: SERP stands for Search Engine Results Page.

questionOption1: Wolf Frameworks uses a C# engine and supports both Microsoft SQL Server and MySQL database
questionOption2: Applications built in Wolf are 50-percent browser-based and support mashable and multisource overlaid content
questionExplanation: Wolf has architected its platform so applications can be built without the need to write technical code.

questionTitle: Which of the following protocol lets a Web site list in an XML file information?
questionExplanation: Sitemaps can be useful in allowing content that isn’t browsable to be crawled.

questionTitle: Which of the following is not provided by “Deep Web”?
questionOption2: Private or limited access Web pages
questionExplanation: Online content that isn’t indexed by search engines belongs to what has come to be called the “Deep Web”.

questionTitle: Dynamic content presented in Google _______ crawling isn’t normally indexed.
questionExplanation: Google now has a procedure that helps the Google engine crawl this information.

questionTitle: Which of the following google product sends you periodic email alerts based on your search term?
questionExplanation: By creating a Google Alert, you can get email notifications any time Google finds new results on a topic that interests you.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a payment processing system by Google?
questionExplanation: Google Checkout was an online payment processing service provided by Google aimed at simplifying the process of paying for online purchases.
